content: Is there a way to signup for monitoring gForge other than: One-at-a-time, or All-of-FHIR. I would like to filter items on a topic, and ask for monitoring of all of them. I tried using the checkbox, but don't see a monitor ability. The monitor control in the left column seems to be all or nothing.

@John Moehrke Not built in. I have a hack that's supposed to email you things "of interest" once a week, but I had to re-set up my Amazon instance because I lost the certificate for my old one and need to re-figure out how to set up email access (and ideally do it this time in a way that doesn't generally route to people's spam folders). You can edit FHIR/Tracker/interestedParties.xml to indicate what you're interested in as an individual. Once I get email working again, you'll get them.
And of course, if/when we migrate from gForge, it might not need to be a hack anymore.
okay. I really just wanted to make sure it wasn't something I was missing. I can live without it. It would be nice to be able to subscribe to updates on a workgroup basis, or Resource basis... thanks
Well, for the work group items, there'll be an email coming out to co-chairs that lists what each work group is interested in, so you can see that there.
